definitions: Changing the form, character, or function of something.
Causing someone to change their religious, political, or other beliefs.
Exchanging something for something else of a different form, type, or value.
Changing from one system or unit to another.
examples: She is converting the old barn into a guesthouse.
The missionary is converting people to a new faith.
They are converting their currency before traveling.
He is converting the measurements to metric units.
